3: Lucia's M.I.N.D. is now shaking violently, killing the lights in her surroundings. The Mind Beacon in the distance seems to have grown dimmer, too.
Something might have happened to Commandant out there. I need to go now. There's still time to stop my M.I.N.D. from being devoured!
The pitch darkness does not stop Lucia.
Shards of memory hover in the air, seemingly luring her to reach out for them.
These... are what happened before the divergence point.
She reaches out for the shard in front of her, but she stops as she hesitates and looks up at the Mind Beacon.
It could be a clue, or it could be a trap to stall me...
Lucia feels much safer seeing the Mind Beacon's soothing light. She reaches out for the shard.
Then, she hears a youthful voice coming from the depths of the abyss...
～Dear black sheep, the child of the sun and winter...～
～Born into a herd of white sheep, trotting across the pure snow.～
Is this... the nursery rhyme from my childhood?
～Dear black sheep, whose black wool the sun loves...～
～Would you share some of your warmth with me?～
Of course. Come and stay here with me.
Luna...
～Dear black sheep, the sheep they all hate...～
～Why must you be different from the rest?～
Lucia, why are they afraid of me?
～Dear black sheep, the sheep without wool...～
Lucia's M.I.N.D. is now shaking violently again, sending the shards of memories flying in the air.
～Bzz... You are special... Zzz... Needs to be caught... Bzz... for more people... Zzz...～
Whether it's Luna or me, being chosen by the Ascension-Network was just the beginning.
The Mind Beacon is now flashing rapidly, as if calling for Lucia.
These memories won't change a thing no matter how much time I spend looking at them. I should go now. They're waiting for me.
The pitch darkness clears up. Right above the abyss, a star shines brighter than ever.
Target found. I'm moving on.
